TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit EntityConnectionStringBuilder extends System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder

Docs.summary: Provides a simple way to create and manage the contents of connection strings used by the EntityClient.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The connection string builder lets developers programmatically create syntactically correct connection strings, and parse and rebuild existing connection strings, by using properties and methods of the class. The connection string builder provides strongly typed properties corresponding to the known keyword/value pairs. Developers who must create connection strings as part of applications can use the EntityConnectionStringBuilder class to build and modify connection strings.
The EntityConnectionStringBuilder performs checks for valid keyword/value pairs, each of which is exposed as a EntityConnectionStringBuilder property value.
> [!NOTE] > The connection string for the underlying data source is supplied by the <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnectionStringBuilder.ProviderConnectionString%2A> property. The supplied provider connection string is not checked for valid keyword/value pairs.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the EntityConnectionStringBuilder in conjunction with a <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnectionStringBuilder>.
[!code-vb[eSQLBasicExamples#BuildingConnectionStringWithEntityCommand](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/eSQLExamplesVB/Program.vb#buildingconnectionstringwithentitycommand)] [!code-cs[eSQLBasicExamples#BuildingConnectionStringWithEntityCommand](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/eSQLExamplesCS/Program.cs#buildingconnectionstringwithentitycommand)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnectionStringBuilder> in conjunction with a <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnectionStringBuilder>. The code sets properties of a `SqlConnectionStringBuilder` to create a <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection> connection string that supplies part of the underlying provider connection string. Note that the Provider name cannot be set using the `SqlConnectionStringBuilder` because it is not valid `SqlConnection` connection string syntax. The code creates the <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnection> connection string by setting `EntityConnectionStringBuilder` properties.
[!code-vb[eSQLBasicExamples#BuildingConnectionStringWithEntityCommand](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/eSQLExamplesVB/Program.vb#buildingconnectionstringwithentitycommand)] [!code-cs[eSQLBasicExamples#BuildingConnectionStringWithEntityCommand](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/eSQLExamplesCS/Program.cs#buildingconnectionstringwithentitycommand)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string connectionString) cil managed

Docs.param: A provider-specific connection string to the underlying data source.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the supplied connection string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The supplied `connectionString` is not checked for valid keyword/value pairs. For valid keyword/value syntax, see <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnection.ConnectionString%2A>.
The invariant Provider name must be specified in the `connectionString` parameter. Supported providers include the following:
- `System.Data.Odbc`
- `System.Data.OleDb`
- `System.Data.OracleClient`
- `System.Data.SqlClient`
- `Microsoft.SqlServerCe.Client`
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnectionStringBuilder> in conjunction with a <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnectionStringBuilder>. The code sets properties of a `SqlConnectionStringBuilder` to create a <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection> connection string that supplies part of the underlying provider connection string. Note that the Provider name cannot be set using the `SqlConnectionStringBuilder` because it is not valid `SqlConnection` connection string syntax. The code creates the <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnection> connection string by setting `EntityConnectionStringBuilder` properties. It does not use the `connectionString` overload.
[!code-vb[eSQLBasicExamples#BuildingConnectionStringWithEntityCommand](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/eSQLExamplesVB/Program.vb#buildingconnectionstringwithentitycommand)] [!code-cs[eSQLBasicExamples#BuildingConnectionStringWithEntityCommand](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/eSQLExamplesCS/Program.cs#buildingconnectionstringwithentitycommand)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Clear() cil managed

Docs.summary: Clears the contents of the instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Clear method removes all keyword/value pairs from the <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnectionStringBuilder> and resets all corresponding properties to null (`Nothing` in [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/add/includes/vbprvb-md.md)]).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool ContainsKey(string keyword) cil managed

Docs.param: The key to locate in the .
Docs.summary: Determines whether the contains a specific key.
Docs.returns: Returns if the contains an element that has the specified key; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the has a fixed size.
Docs.value: Returns in every case, because the supplies a fixed-size collection of keyword/value pairs.

MemberSignature.Value: public override object this[string keyword] { get; set; }

Docs.param: The key of the item to get or set.
Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value associated with the specified key. In C#, this property is the indexer.
Docs.value: The value associated with the specified key.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Because the <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnectionStringBuilder> contains a fixed-size dictionary, trying to add a key that does not exist in the dictionary throws a <xref:System.Collections.Generic.KeyNotFoundException>.
For valid keyword/value syntax, see <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnection.ConnectionString%2A>.

Docs.exception: Tried to add a key that does not exist in the available keys.
Invalid value in the connection string (specifically, a Boolean or numeric value was expected but not supplied).

Docs.summary: Gets an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> that contains the keys in the .
Docs.value: An <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> that contains the keys in the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks For valid keyword/value syntax, see <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnection.ConnectionString%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the metadata locations in the connection string.
Docs.value: Gets or sets the metadata locations in the connection string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For valid keyword/value syntax, see <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnection.ConnectionString%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of a section as defined in a configuration file.
Docs.value: The name of a section in a configuration file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For valid keyword/value syntax, see <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnection.ConnectionString%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the underlying [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] data provider in the connection string.
Docs.value: The invariant name of the underlying [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] data provider.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The invariant provider name is used retrieve the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbProviderFactory> object for the underlying provider.
For valid keyword/value syntax, see <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnection.ConnectionString%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the inner, provider-specific connection string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The provider-specific connection string is not checked for valid keyword/value pairs before it is set. Developers can create connection strings by using either a strongly typed connection string builder class, or they can use the <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> class. The <xref:System.Data.Common.DbConnectionStringBuilder> performs no checks for valid keyword/value pairs. Therefore, it is possible using this class to create invalid connection strings.
For valid keyword/value syntax, see <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnection.ConnectionString%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool Remove(string keyword) cil managed

Docs.param: The key of the keyword/value pair to be removed from the connection string in this .
Docs.summary: Removes the entry with the specified key from the instance.
Docs.returns: Returns if the key existed in the connection string and was removed; if the key did not exist.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Because the `Remove` method returns a value that indicates its success, it is not required to look for a key before trying to remove the keyword/value pair from the <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnectionStringBuilder> instance.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool TryGetValue (string keyword, out object value);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool TryGetValue(string keyword, object value) cil managed

Docs.param: The key of the item to retrieve.
Docs.summary: Retrieves a value corresponding to the supplied key from this .
Docs.returns: Returns if was found in the connection string; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The TryGetValue method lets developers safely retrieve a value from a <xref:System.Data.EntityClient.EntityConnectionStringBuilder> without having to verify that the supplied key name is a valid key name. `TryGetValue` does not raise an exception when it is passed a nonexistent key. Calling `TryGetValue` with a nonexistent key puts the value null (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) in the `value` parameter.

Docs.exception: contains a null value ( in Visual Basic).
